data.title: LEADING LADY WAS NAZI'S FRIEND— So Anton Walbrook walked out
data.meta_description: THE Austrian-born British actor, Anton Walbrook, went to Germany to play the leading role in a film without knowing who the leading lady was. ...
data.text:
They met for the first time

at a party—and Walbrook, after

looking speechless at the lady,

walked out.

The lady was beautiful Czech-

born Lida Baarova, favourite

actress of the Nazi Propaganda

Minister, Goebbels.

Walbrook told the film pro-

ducers that he regarded the

negotiations as broken off.

To his friends he said: "I

don't know the lady. I regard

it as an offence to my human

artistic dignity to have been

suggested as co-star to

Baarova."

[Anton Walbrook is currently

appearing in Australia in the

film "Red Shoes."]

Lida Baarova is regarded as

one of the most beautiful women

in Europe.

In 1938 Goebbels was beaten

by her husband, Gustav Froe-

lich, and Goebbels' wife threat-

ened to institute divorce pro-

ceedings, naming Lida. Only

Hitler's intervention prevented

disruption of the Goebbels'

home.

Lida was "exiled" to Prague

from Berlin, and Froelich was

thrown into a concentration

camp.
